FuncDef: The upgrade sfu command upgrades the items of one SFU or multiple SFUs, BootROM, firmware, and MonitorBus included.
CLIs: upgrade sfu { all | slot <slot-id> } { startup | <filename> } { all-item | firmware | monitorbus } [ force ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates all SFUs that are installed.
-

Upgrades the SFU in a specified slot.
The value is the slot number of the in-position SFU.

Upgrades the router to the current startup system software.
-

Specifies the name of the system software stored in the Cfcard.
The value is a string of 4 to 127 characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates all items on an SFU.
-

Indicates the firmware of the SFU.
-

Upgrades the MonitorBus of the SFU.
-

Forces the upgrade, regardless of the version consistency.
-

Examples: *                     W A R N I N G                     *
* Please ensure that the configuration has been saved.  *
* And please ensure that the board does not be powered  *
* off or be reseted during the upgrade operation.       *
* Also ensure that any board of this device is not      *
* removed (pull out or plug in) during this process.    *
*                     W A R N I N G                     *
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If an SFU does not operate properly but the display device command output shows that the SFU has successfully registered, run the upgrade sfu command to upgrade the SFU to troubleshoot the fault.
Implementation Procedure
When using the upgrade sfu command, enter Y or N to determine whether to execute the command.
Configuration Impact
There are two modes for upgrading the items:
Upgrade the items without using the parameter force.
The system first checks whether the items of the SFU match the system software. Then, it upgrades the unmatched items.
Upgrade the items using the parameter force.
The system directly upgrades all the items of the SFU without checking whether these items match the system software.
Procedure
When running the upgrade sfu command, enter Y or N to decide whether to run the command.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
